page.title: 14RELIGION IN KEMPSTON
page.content: Within the urban area there are 3 main places of worship;{The Church of the {Transfiguration,}a 20th Century brick- built Anglican building, and two {Methodist Chapels, Kempston East and {West}the latter being the most recent. All three Christian places of worship generate a wide variety of{activities ranging from Sunday School,youth group Womens' Discussion Groups,Men's Groups and many social events and outings. {Congregations}are diminishing and although some lively youth groups involve children for some years, the {majority are aged over 40.}Despite a large resident{immigrant community there are no temples, mosques or other places of worship for the Sikhs,Hindus or Muslims within our area. Most of these will travel to Bedford. Within {school communities}most are happy to attend the daily Religious Assembly.
